issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares getTotalNumberOfStudents() with return type String, while the provided solution implements getTotalNumberOfStudents() returning int. The problem text even tells students to use the UML to determine the expected return type, which will mislead students into implementing a String-returning method while the intended/solution implementation (and the natural numeric meaning of the method) is an int.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the return type consistent across artifacts. Best fix: update the UML in the problem statement to declare getTotalNumberOfStudents(): int (and update any textual hints that point students to the UML). This preserves the intended numeric semantics and matches the solution implementation. Alternatively, if a String return was intended, change the solution (and tests) to return a String, but updating the UML to int is recommended.
